questions.question: I think I will be staying here for ……………………… more days.
questions.description: A few indicates a small number few means almost none.

questions.question: She is junior ……………………….. me.
questions.description: The words junior, senior, superior and inferior are followed by to.

questions.question: The exam was ………………………… than I thought.
questions.description: Easier is the comparative form of easy.

questions.question: He is …………………………… than me.
questions.description: Cleverer is the comparative form of clever.

questions.question: Take ……………………………. of the two routes.
questions.description: When the comparison is between two people or things, the comparative form is preferred.

questions.question: He is …………………………… of the three brothers.
questions.description: When the comparison is among more than two people or things, the superlative form is used.

questions.question: He is …………………………… than you.
questions.description: Much can modify comparatives. More cannot modify comparatives.

questions.question: I don’t earn as much as ……………………………..
questions.description: Object pronouns are preferred after as and than.

questions.question: English is widely …………………………….. in India.
questions.description: In passive structures use the third form of the verb.

questions.question: I love you more than ………………………………
questions.description: Object pronouns are preferred after as and than.
